Directly contributes to creating a signed contract, which is the end product of this activity.
Ensures that the tenant understands the terms of the contract, directly contributing to the creation of a valid and enforceable agreement.
Obtaining the necessary signatures is essential for the contract to be legally binding, directly contributing to the completion of the contract.

substeps.description: Provide copy of signed contract to tenant
substeps.reasoning: Enables the tenant to have a copy of the signed contract, directly adding value by ensuring transparency and clarity.
Assessing the property's condition before the tenant moves in ensures that any existing damages are documented, directly contributing to the smooth move-in process.
Enables the tenant to access and occupy the property, directly delivering the core value of the rental agreement.
Updating the property status in the system accurately reflects the occupancy status, directly contributing to the management of the property.
Reminding the tenant to pay rent ensures timely payment, directly contributing to the financial stability of the rental business.
Receiving the rent payment is the primary goal of this activity, directly adding value by generating revenue.
Accurately recording the rent payment in the system ensures proper financial tracking, directly contributing to financial reporting and analysis.
Providing a receipt to the tenant confirms the payment and serves as a record, directly adding value by ensuring transparency and accountability.
Identifying the missed rent payment is crucial for initiating the appropriate actions to address the issue, directly contributing to the resolution of the payment problem.
Recording the missed payment in the system ensures accurate financial tracking and reporting, directly contributing to financial management.
Initiating the late payment process enables the rental business to take appropriate actions to collect the overdue payment, directly contributing to the resolution of the payment issue.
This step consumes resources without directly adding value to the customer or business. It is an administrative task that does not contribute to the creation of the end product or service.

This step is necessary for maintaining accurate records and ensuring compliance with company policies, but it does not directly add value to the customer.

This step is necessary for ensuring compliance with lease agreements and reducing financial risk, but it is not directly valued by the customer.
This step directly contributes to the creation of the end product by terminating the lease agreement.
